blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: I know we all wanted Percy to meet Molly but imagine Rich Kid Percy meeting Caduceus ‘Having Lots of Money Just Makes Your...
body:
I know we all wanted Percy to meet Molly but imagine Rich Kid Percy meeting Caduceus ‘Having Lots of Money Just Makes Your Pockets Heavy’ Clay.

Also Caduceus ‘How Much Money is 400 Gold’ Clay, who spent one gold on some fucking garlic.

blog.name: night-filled-mountain
blog.description:
“Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.”

-Albert Camus, “The Myth of Sisyphus”

summary: Just went back and re-watched Jester and Nott’s temple hijinks expressly to make a list of every magical ability Jester used (or...
body:
Just went back and re-watched Jester and Nott’s temple hijinks expressly to make a list of every magical ability Jester used (or tried to use) over the course of that one fiasco. In chronological order:

  • Disguise Self
  • Invoke Duplicity
  • Blink
  • Charm Person
  • Hold Person
  • Dispel Magic
  • Mirror Image
  • Cloak of Shadows

…Just remembering the Talks Machina where Laura was so excited that Taliesin was playing a cleric now, because it freed Jester up to use her magic in creative non-healing ways. …She did not waste any time.  😂

EDITED to add: I just remembered that the first time Jester tried out Cloak of Shadows, Nott said to her, “Maybe next time you use it, it will have a purpose,” and I am even more amused now.  😂 😂

summary: crack headcanon: Yasha and Beau’s new owl (here dubbed “Owly” for brevity and because I am unimaginative trash) do not get...
body:
crack headcanon: Yasha and Beau’s new owl (here dubbed “Owly” for brevity and because I am unimaginative trash) do not get along.

Which, at least at first, is not saying much. Beau and Owly were pretty much made for each other: an asshole monk and her asshole owl. But Beau is just a little bit more of an asshole, and eventually begrudgingly earns Owly’s undying respect and loyalty.  Which apparently comes with an intense jealousy streak, as Owly does not like this gargantuan human that is taking all of their Human’s time and attention from it. The rest of the Mighty Nein laugh at Yasha when she tries to tell them because, yeah, the bird’s an asshole, but do you really think it has it out for you?

Yes. Yes it does.

  • Every time she tries to talk to Beau alone, that damn bird has to perch itself on her shoulder, and it’s already so hard for Yasha to speak; let alone, to her crush; let alone, when said crush has a very judgmental owl twisting its head 180 degrees to pierce through her soul with its Glare.
  • Supposedly, animals bring dead prey to humans that they like as a gift, or because they think they’re too dumb to hunt themselves. Personally, Yasha thinks it’s a little bit of the latter mixed with a whole lot of spite after the umpteenth dead animal in her bedroll, and how the hell did it get a very alive and very angry quasit in there??
  • She tries to pick Beau flowers. Tries. She nearly succeeds, but that damn bird comes out of nowhere, swoops them right out of her hand and replaces them with–wow, that is a very small dragon.

Eventually the rest of the Mighty Nein are forced to concede that okay, maybe that owl does hate you, Yasha. Then Caduceus finally remembers that he can talk to animals and…yeah. Owly does not like Yasha. Everyone finds it hilarious that their stoic, yet sweet angel of death somehow has a feud with a bird that is literally 1/73 of her size; except Beau who is truly an oblivious Disaster Lesbian, stoked that her two favorite balls of rage are getting along.

summary: what is critical role? I've seen your aesthetic boards and they're really cool!
question: what is critical role? I've seen your aesthetic boards and they're really cool!
answer: Critical Role is a twitch show that features Matthew Mercer and his group of friends (Laura Bailey, Travis Willingham, Liam O’Brien, Ashley Johnson, Marisha Ray, and Sam Riegel) as they play D&D. They have 2 campaigns, one that has 115 episodes and it completed though it was started before the stream actually started, and then campaign 2 has 32 episodes (I think) and all of those characters are new. It’s an amazing show, Matt is an amazing storyteller and everyone is really good at roleplaying and staying true to their character and I highly recommend watching it.

They have 2 campaigns, one that has 115 episodes and it completed though it was started before the stream actually started, and then campaign 2 has 32 episodes (I think) and all of those characters are new. It’s an amazing show, Matt is an amazing storyteller and everyone is really good at roleplaying and staying true to their character and I highly recommend watching it.

blog.name: sylvansie
blog.title: The Escape Corner
blog.description: Where the images in my head go to live

summary: Critrole: the animals
body:
Critrole: the animals

Me: “That ornery owl? Just like Beau!”

Marisha-as-Beau: “We’re so much alike!”

Me: “Please call it Belle please please please!”

(They won’t. But I can hope.)

Jester died of the cute. Shut up, Caleb, she deserves something nice.

summary: No One Told You - Chapter 1 - Midnight_Ophelia - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: No One Told You - Chapter 1 - Midnight_Ophelia - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 2/?
Fandom: Critical Role (Web Series)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Mollymauk Tealeaf/Caleb Widogast
Characters: Caleb Widogast, Mollymauk Tealeaf, Fjord (Critical Role), Jester (Critical Role), Yasha (Critical Role), Nott (Critical Role), Beauregard (Critical Role), Caduceus Clay, Percival “Percy” Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III, Vex'ahlia (Critical Role), Vax'ildan (Critical Role), Keyleth (Critical Role), Shaun Gilmore, Astrid (Critical Role), Eodwulf (Critical Role), Original Characters
Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Sex Work, Fake/Pretend Relationship, Slow Burn, Mutual Pining, Pretty Woman References, Sharing a Bed, Recreational Drug Use, Background Relationships, Friends to Lovers, Other Additional Tags to Be Added, No Magic but everyone is the same species, Modern Exandria, Fun with Tropes, Fluff, Eventual Sex, rating to go up
Summary:

“So you’re telling me that you want to pay me to come with you to Emon and pretend to be your partner so you don’t have to be on your own as you inherit an obscene amount of money. Or rather turn it down,” Molly asks, eyebrow raised.

Caleb’s heart skips a beat. “You do not have to. I understand that this is very sudden.”

“I’ll do it.”

“You…will?”

“Hells yeah. Get paid to fake-date a handsome man, go to a different country, and get to stay in a swanky hotel? It’s a dream come true is what it is.”

Chapter Two Preview: 

Molly doesn’t really see much of Caleb for the rest of that month. It’s not like Molly’s actively avoiding him or anything, quite the contrary actually, but it’s starting to feel like Caleb is. Sure, they briefly pass each other in the mail room each week, but as soon as Caleb sees him he grabs his stuff and hustles out like there’s a fire on his arse. It’s hard not to feel a little insulted.

Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Sex Work, Fake/Pretend Relationship, Slow Burn, Mutual Pining, Pretty Woman References, Sharing a Bed, Recreational Drug Use, Background Relationships, Friends to Lovers, Other Additional Tags to Be Added, No Magic but everyone is the same species, Modern Exandria, Fun with Tropes, Fluff, Eventual Sex, rating to go up
Summary:

“So you’re telling me that you want to pay me to come with you to Emon and pretend to be your partner so you don’t have to be on your own as you inherit an obscene amount of money. Or rather turn it down,” Molly asks, eyebrow raised.

Caleb’s heart skips a beat. “You do not have to. I understand that this is very sudden.”

“I’ll do it.”

“You…will?”

“Hells yeah. Get paid to fake-date a handsome man, go to a different country, and get to stay in a swanky hotel? It’s a dream come true is what it is.”

Chapter Two Preview: 

Molly doesn’t really see much of Caleb for the rest of that month. It’s not like Molly’s actively avoiding him or anything, quite the contrary actually, but it’s starting to feel like Caleb is. Sure, they briefly pass each other in the mail room each week, but as soon as Caleb sees him he grabs his stuff and hustles out like there’s a fire on his arse. It’s hard not to feel a little insulted.
